Person.Organization: BROAD INSTITUTE, INC.BRIGHAM AND WOMEN'S HOSPITALMASSACHUSETTS GENERAL HOSPITAL

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Funding support for the NIH Roadmap Epigenomics Program was provided through the NIH Common Fund (Office of Strategic Coordination). Support for collection of datasets and samples was provided by a series of UO1 cooperative agreements with The Broad Institute [1U01ES017155-01], The Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research [1U01ES017166-01], The University of California San Francisco [1U01ES017154-01], and The University of Washington [1U01ES017156-01]. Data analysis and coordination were supported by an agreement with Baylor College of Medicine [1U01DA025956-01]. Assistance with data curation was supplied by GEO, and data access and visualization was supported by the NCBI. All authors using these data should cite the original publication giving an overview of the program: The NIH Roadmap Epigenomics Mapping Consortium, Bernstein BE et al, Nature Biotechnology 28, 1045–1048 (2010), and make reference to the website for the consortium: http://www.roadmapepigenomics.org/

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Alzheimer's and age related conditions
ConsentGroup.name: AARC
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Consented to research in support of studies aimed at understanding the causes of Alzheimer’s disease and other age-related conditions.
